results.title: Down in the deep = Sunken treasure
results.creator_credit: Paul Terry, Terrytoon Cartoons, Mannie Davis and George Gordon
results.brief_description: Features Puddy the Pup. Finding a treasure map, Puddy and his young master set out to find the gold on the ocean floor.

results.title: Down by law [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Alan Kleinberg, Black Snake, Grokenberger and Jim Jarmusch
results.brief_description: It is a sad and beautiful world that provides the setting for Jim Jarmusch’s third feature. It seems like a world of bad luck and trouble to Jack and Zack. These deadbeats may well have deserved a comeuppance, but not jail, certainly not for the long haul, and absolutely not in the same cell together. The big-talking, foolish Jack and the sullen, daydreaming Zack are mutually repellent. A new convict is pushed into their cell, an Italian tourist, Roberto. Somehow the three manage to escape and they wind up in the trackless bayou, pursued by bloodhounds. Cast includes Tom Waits, John Lurie, Roberto Benigni and Ellen Barkin.

results.title: Down and out in Beverly Hills
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Paul Mazursky and Pato Guzman
results.brief_description: A wealthy but bitterly unhappy married couple take in a tramp who attempts suicide in their pool. Becoming ensconced in their lives, the tramp (played by Nick Nolte) facilitates a re-evaluation of the family’s dubious moral codes. A remake of Jean Renoir’s 1932 film “Boudu saved from drowning” this hilarious comedy with Richard Dreyfuss and Bette Midler as the warring couple, garnered many accolades and was nominated for two Golden Globes.

results.title: Down and out
results.creator_credit: Colin Thomas, Peter Lord, David Sproxton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
Based on a real life conversation, clay models are animated to act out the problems of a man attempting to get a meal from a welfare agency.

results.title: Down and out
results.creator_credit: Journal Films and Gilbert Altschul Productions
results.brief_description: The film depicts one of the most common causes of injury in workshop situations - falling. It examines the common hazards which cause people to lose their balance; over-reaching, taking short cuts, failure to check eqiupment, and not looking where one is going.

results.title: Down a long way: the story of an oilwell
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, British Petroleum and Bob Privett
results.brief_description: Light-hearted animation describes methods of finding oil. Geologists can deduce the presence of a favourable underground formation from surface observations, and the geophysicist can then site a well, with some accuracy, by plotting the actual shape of the underground strata. Describes drilling and sampling operations which give access to the imprisoned oil.

results.title: Dover: spring 1947
results.creator_credit: Data Film Productions, Papua New Guinea. Office of Information and Mary Beales
results.brief_description: A study of the rebuilding program of the English Channel town of Dover, which suffered heavy damage from shellfire during WWII. The historic town is to be, very largely, rebuilt on a new site, and extensive use is to be made of recently developed prefabrication techniques. Good use of British humour gives this doco additional interest.

results.title: Douglas Point Nuclear Power Station
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and Atomic Energy of Canada
results.brief_description: The success of this first full-scale nuclear power station on the shores of Lake Huron has shown the way for the economic large-scale production of electricity from uranium. This film describes the plant at Douglas Point, Ontario, and the process by which the uranium atom is split, employing heavy water with a special property, deuterium, giving the name CANDU (Canada Deuterium Uranium) to the Canadian system of atomic energy production.

results.title: Douglas Mawson: the survivor
results.brief_description: During an expedition to Antarctica in 1912, Mawson’s two companions perished leaving him, ill and weak, to struggle back alone to a base camp at Commonwealth Bay. A reconstruction of the tragic expedition is the pivot of the documentary, which also includes interviews with the explorer-scientist’s daughters, contemporaries and students.
